channel.description: The latest health and science news. Updates on medicine, healthy living, nutrition, drugs, diet, and advances in science and technology. Subscribe to the Health & Science podcast.

item.title: To Put You At Ease With Creepy-Crawlies, Entomologists Face Your Fears
item.description:
March 26, 2017 - Nancy Miorelli posts photos of insects on her face on social media in hopes that the images will help normalize insects.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/03/26/520250032/to-put-you-at-ease-with-creepy-crawlies-entomologists-face-your-fears
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: Telehealth Doctor Visits May Be Handy, But Aren't Cheaper Overall
item.description: March 26, 2017 - Many patients like the convenience of being able to quickly consult a doctor by text or phone or webcam instead of heading to an urgent care clinic. But the cost of consultations can add up.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 26, 2017 - Many patients like the convenience of being able to quickly consult a doctor by text or phone or webcam instead of heading to an urgent care clinic. But the cost of consultations can add up. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/26/519543337/telehealth-doctor-visits-may-be-handy-but-arent-cheaper-overall

item.title: Brain Tumor Defense For Jewish Center Bomb Threat Suspect Recalls 1991 Murder Trial
item.description: March 25, 2017 - Ken Davis's book, "The Brain Defense," looks at the murder trial of Herbert Weinstein, in which lawyers argued that Weinstein was not guilty of killing his wife, because he had a brain tumor.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 25, 2017 - Ken Davis's book, "The Brain Defense," looks at the murder trial of Herbert Weinstein, in which lawyers argued that Weinstein was not guilty of killing his wife, because he had a brain tumor. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/25/521517166/lawyers-brain-tumor-defense-for-jewish-center-bomb-threat-suspect-recalls-1991-m

item.title: March Madness Vasectomies Encourage Guys To Take One For The Team
item.description: March 24, 2017 - Some urologists use March Madness as an opportunity to market vasectomy services, offering men the excuse to sit on the sofa for three days to watch college basketball while they recover.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 24, 2017 - Some urologists use March Madness as an opportunity to market vasectomy services, offering men the excuse to sit on the sofa for three days to watch college basketball while they recover. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/24/521258200/march-madness-vasectomies-encourage-guys-to-take-one-for-the-team

item.title: The U.S. Can't Really Know If Farmers Are Cutting Back On Antibiotics, GAO Says
item.description: March 24, 2017 - New FDA rules limit how farmers can give antibiotics to animals raised for meat. But a Government Accountability Office report says the FDA doesn't collect the data to know if that policy is working.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 24, 2017 - New FDA rules limit how farmers can give antibiotics to animals raised for meat. But a Government Accountability Office report says the FDA doesn't collect the data to know if that policy is working. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/03/24/521281145/the-u-s-can-t-really-know-if-farmers-are-cutting-back-on-antibiotics-gao-says

item.title: Cancer Is Partly Caused By Bad Luck, Study Finds
item.description: March 23, 2017 - Researchers have long known behavior, environment and genetics play a role in cancer. A study in Science finds luck is also a major factor. Nearly two-thirds of cancer mutations arise randomly.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 23, 2017 - Researchers have long known behavior, environment and genetics play a role in cancer. A study in Science finds luck is also a major factor. Nearly two-thirds of cancer mutations arise randomly. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/23/521219318/cancer-is-partly-caused-by-bad-luck-study-finds

item.title: Kids Who Suffer Hunger In First Years Lag Behind Their Peers In School
item.description: March 23, 2017 - When infants and young kids grow up in homes without enough to eat, they're more likely to perform poorly in kindergarten, a study shows. The younger they experienced hunger, the stronger the effect.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 23, 2017 - When infants and young kids grow up in homes without enough to eat, they're more likely to perform poorly in kindergarten, a study shows. The younger they experienced hunger, the stronger the effect. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/03/23/520997010/kids-who-suffer-hunger-in-first-years-lag-behind-their-peers-in-school

item.title: Science-Loving Teens From Ghana And D.C. Geek Out Together
item.description: March 23, 2017 - They competed in the first World Smarts STEM Challenge. We got to know the team that worked on a water purifier using neem leaves and ... cilantro.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 23, 2017 - They competed in the first World Smarts STEM Challenge. We got to know the team that worked on a water purifier using neem leaves and ... cilantro. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/03/23/520864034/science-loving-teens-from-ghana-and-d-c-geek-out-together

item.title: How The 'Scarcity Mindset' Can Make Problems Worse
item.description: March 23, 2017 - Researchers had a hypothesis that when you really want something, you start to focus on it obsessively. It produces a kind of tunnel vision and creates problems for thinking in the long-term.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 23, 2017 - Researchers had a hypothesis that when you really want something, you start to focus on it obsessively. It produces a kind of tunnel vision and creates problems for thinking in the long-term. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/23/521195903/how-the-scarcity-mindset-can-make-problems-worse

item.title: The Forces Driving Middle-Aged White People's 'Deaths Of Despair'
item.description: March 23, 2017 - Middle-aged white people without college degrees are increasingly likely to die of suicide or drug and alcohol abuse. The lack of a pathway to solid jobs is one reason, two economists say.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 23, 2017 - Middle-aged white people without college degrees are increasingly likely to die of suicide or drug and alcohol abuse. The lack of a pathway to solid jobs is one reason, two economists say. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/23/521083335/the-forces-driving-middle-aged-white-peoples-deaths-of-despair

item.title: Doctor Turns Up Possible Treatment For Deadly Sepsis
item.description: March 23, 2017 - Research hasn't yet confirmed the early hints that a mix of IV vitamins and steroids might stop the fatal organ failure of sepsis. But an effective treatment for sepsis would be a really big deal.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 23, 2017 - Research hasn't yet confirmed the early hints that a mix of IV vitamins and steroids might stop the fatal organ failure of sepsis. But an effective treatment for sepsis would be a really big deal. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/23/521096488/doctor-turns-up-possible-treatment-for-deadly-sepsis

item.title: Social Media, Math And The Mystery Of A Mumps Outbreak
item.description: March 22, 2017 - Since August 2016, there have been nearly 3,000 cases of mumps diagnosed in Arkansas. A epidemiologist explains how her team used online data and mathematical modeling to understand the outbreak.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 22, 2017 - Since August 2016, there have been nearly 3,000 cases of mumps diagnosed in Arkansas. A epidemiologist explains how her team used online data and mathematical modeling to understand the outbreak. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/22/520842043/social-media-math-and-the-mystery-of-a-mumps-outbreak

item.title: Powdered Vaccine Raises Hopes Of Stopping A Top Killer Of Kids
item.description: March 22, 2017 - It's aimed at rotavirus, a nasty pathogen that can cause diarrhea and kills more than 500 children a day. The secret to the vaccine is the same thing that makes space ice cream so cool.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 22, 2017 - It's aimed at rotavirus, a nasty pathogen that can cause diarrhea and kills more than 500 children a day. The secret to the vaccine is the same thing that makes space ice cream so cool. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/03/22/521094735/powdered-vaccine-raises-hopes-of-stopping-a-top-killer-of-kids

item.title: A Smartphone Can Accurately Test Sperm Count
item.description: March 22, 2017 - Measuring the quality of those little swimmers usually requires a trip to the doctor. Researchers have come up with a smartphone accessory that would let men do that at home in less than five seconds.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 22, 2017 - Measuring the quality of those little swimmers usually requires a trip to the doctor. Researchers have come up with a smartphone accessory that would let men do that at home in less than five seconds. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/22/520837557/a-smartphone-can-accurately-test-sperm-count

item.title: Congress Rolls Back Obama-Era Rule On Hunting Bears And Wolves In Alaska
item.description: March 22, 2017 - The Senate voted Tuesday to lift a 2016 ban on certain hunting practices — like trapping and aerial shooting — on national wildlife refuges there. Now the bill heads to President Trump to be signed.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 22, 2017 - The Senate voted Tuesday to lift a 2016 ban on certain hunting practices — like trapping and aerial shooting — on national wildlife refuges there. Now the bill heads to President Trump to be signed. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/03/22/521089304/congress-rolls-back-obama-era-rule-on-hunting-bears-and-wolves-in-alaska
